There's a tall plant in the hall.  The Hider stuffs the Burglar's face in the pot, suffocating him in the soggy earth.  The Burglar's body twists and turns and kicks as he's smothered in the damp dirt, the tall plant shaking above the two of them, casting horrible shadows around th entrance hall in the moonlight cast from the skylight. The Hider can barely hold the Burglar's head in place, every muscle tensing as the Burglar's body shudders in rebellion -- and then the tremendous surge as the Burglar body breaks free!  -- Tall plant tipping as the Burglar pushes back against the Hider with unbelievable strength -- tall plant falling -- the Burglar knocking the Hider back flat on the floor, the Burglar on top, but the Hider still hugging him in a death grip, then getting a full-nelson hold on the Burglar's shoulders and neck, the two of them struggling to a standing position again, the Hider again smacking the Burglar's head again and again a again, into the front door this time, the Burglar sinking back to the floor, still resisting, still breathing, his good hand still madly feeling for a grip on the Hider, bu this time the Hider's hold is too strong and when he's go the Burglar on the floor again, he's able to get a knee into the small of the Burglar's back and with the knee as leverage and the full nelson on the Burglar's neck, the Hider pulls back with every last ounce of strength, pulling, pulling, moaning with the sheer effort of it unt -- the Burglar's neck BREAKS. The Hider rolls off, gasping for breath.  He pulls himsel to a sitting position against the front door.  He sits here in the entrance hall under the moonlit skylight with the shadows and the dead Burglar and the blood and the earth all over the floor and he breathes air into his lun as if he'll never get enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider enters, carrying over his shoulder a giant-size black Hefty trash bag with the body of the Burglar in it. From his pocket he takes -- the keys to Phil's car.  He lays the body bag on the floor in the back and gets in th front.  He adjusts the driver's seat to suit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider, driving Phil's car, turns into a filthy alley. Halfway along it he parks, gets out, pulls the body bag out, dumps it callously on the ground, and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider buys a green vase identical to the one that smashed in his burglar fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wrapping vase) I knew you'd be back for another one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider walks along a path with a man named BERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You test each one thoroughly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better believe it, buddy. Your average Rolls Royce doesn't have to pass as many tests.  You want consistency?  You want dependability?  You want safety?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Safety?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you can kick 'em, hit 'em, pour water all over 'em -- nothing.  I'm telling you, under ordinary conditions they're quiet, they're nice to have around, they're completely harmless -- but when you blow this whistle... (holds up a whistle) ... then look out.

dialogues.speaker: A VICIOUS, SAVAGE KILLER DOG
dialogues.text: LUNGING directly AT THE CAMERA!  Snarling fiercely. This is the "product" under discussion -- attacking a Man who's wearing considerable protective, padded clothing. It's a simulated "mugging" demonstration.  The Man in the clothing and face mask is playing the part of the mugger, while a Woman Dog Trainer is the victim -- with a whistle in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.  You can't buy better protection than that.  That there is your Man's Best Friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are they with kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're great with kids.  They love 'em.  They eat 'em up. (gives the Hider a friendly slap) I'm kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at whistle) So this really does the trick, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend, that animal will go after whoever's approaching the sound of that whistle.  And God help whoever it is.  Because that dog will not let up until there's dead meat on the ground.  Put your faith in that, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The padded Man is indeed on the ground, the Killer Dog attacking him viciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family comes back in.  The kids immediately dropping their bags and rushing upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, don't leave your bags in the hall -- take them upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Julie have a look round.  Everything looks fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Did the cleaning woman come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the living room) Yeah -- she did a good job.  This glass looks brand-new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (And the green vase is back in place on the mantelpiece.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor has a nice shine to it. (going into kitchen) Oh God -- we have twenty-two messages on the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming from living room) Did she water this plant?  It looks a little bent out of shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids come rushing in excitedly from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!  Dad!  Mom!  Dad!  Come look, come and look, come and look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Phil are dragged outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids pull Julie and Phil out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look.  The savage Killer Dog is sitting here -- looking like the friendliest, cuddliest lost thing you ev saw, tongue hanging out, the sweetest Disney image of doghood imaginable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He was lying asleep at the back of the yard like it was home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And there's no collar or tags on him or nothin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we keep him, Mom, oh, can we? Can we keep him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Phil laugh.  They crouch down with the kids to pet the Killer Dog, too.  The Killer Dog is happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, sport.  Where'd you come from, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we keep him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Killer Dog licks Phil's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are watching MTV in the living room.  The Killer Dog strolls out, wearing a collar.  In the dining room Ph is pacing nervously as he talks on the kitchen phone, stretched in here on the super-long flex cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensational.  Wednesday is fine, no problemo.  One o'clock at the Somerset Grill -- yes, I know it well.  Okay then -- looking forward to it.  Ciao. (again a double click) Hello?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the kitchen to hang up, punching the air triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is preparing dinner.  The Killer Dog walks to the d bowl to munch his chow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to see me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip!  The senior partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His secretary just confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him, giving him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the redial button on his phone extension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, this is Phil Dreyer again. Stupidly, I just looked at my calendar and I'm going to have to cancel Wednesday.  Please apologize to him for me and I'll call back to reschedule -- is that all right?  No problemo? Sensational.  Thanks -- I'm really sorry.  Ciao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Phil hugging and kissing.  The MUSIC coming fro the liVing room.  Julie starts dancing slowly with Phil - but he wants to break it up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should feel like dancing at a time like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to break away) C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie lets him go, pissed off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can never bring yourself to do anything spontaneous or romantic, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Phil is pissed off that she's pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought the house, dear heart -- we took the vacation.  I deliver your dreams from time to time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts walking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dance is for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.  With a sigh she turns back to her cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wakes up suddenly from sleep.  He hears something.  He smells something.  He sniffs.  He crawls over to look through the vent in the false wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and his friends are here.  The attic is full of all kinds of junk.  Neil and his friends are playing with matches -- melting a naked "G.I. Joe."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, look at him burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider is appalled by this sadistic game.  Suddenly, h almost hits the ceiling -- as his PHONE RINGS!  He instantly disconnects it, and waits with horror to see if it's given him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONES are still RINGING in the rest of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys have a loud phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Hi, Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes writing a note to himself and posts it on his bulletin board:  "ALWAYS REMEMBER TO UNPLUG THE PHONE!!!" Then he turns over the phone to turn the "ring" dial to low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie on the phone with her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh... uh huh... You didn't even have dinner with him first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keeping one eye on the antics of the kids in the attic, t Hider reconnects his phone so he can listen in on Julie's conversation, holding a cloth over the mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie hears PHIL COMING HOME.  CAR DOOR SLAMMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh... uh huh... Well, Rita, if he's that big a slob, why are you even bothering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil comes in, head down, goes straight upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Rita, I'm going to have to call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Neil or one of his idiot friends drops a match a accidentally sets on fire a roll of carpet lying against the Hider's wall.  The roll of carpet is wrapped in brown paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it out, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys frantically try to put out the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ, Oh God, Oh Jesus, Oh Christ, Oh God -- the Hid puts the phone down and pulls the ventilator lever shut a backs off as far as his terribly limited space allows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is lying on the bed as Julie comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?  How did it go?  You didn't call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes to sit on the bed.  She tries putting a hand on him, but it's like putting a hand on a corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get to the restaurant and he's not there. I waited for forty- five minutes.  When I called his office, his secretary said they thought I had cancelled.  I had cancelled!  Then I get back to my office and Aranson is waiting for me and he knows everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything -- that I've been talking to other people behind his back -- that's what he called me -- a back-stabber and a deceiver. To him and to the company. He called me a traitor in front of everybody and told me if I wanted to be a VP over at Lowenthal I might as well pack up and go -- only Lowenthal never

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: showed up for our lunch!  It's like everybody got an anonymous poison-pen letter or some -- (sits up) Do you smell smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil comes running up as Neil was rushing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!  Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carpet is blazing!  Noxious smoke pouring off it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't stop the smoke coming through his vent.  His little cell is quickly flooding with smoke.  Choking, gasping, he throws himself down on his mattress, sticking his face to the second vent in the street wall, sucking t real air from out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil slaps at the fire with another rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, go get some water!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That small vent up by the attic -- smoke coming from it. UP CLOSE, a man's hideously distorted and desperate face pressed against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies there gasping for air, more smoke filling his sma space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and Julie rush back up with buckets of water.  After a lot more screaming and yelling and exertion, the flames are put out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil shouts at Neil and his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you guys think you were doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all have their heads down.  Phil opens the front doo to get rid of Neil's friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You two get out of here, go on. Your parents are going to be hearing from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the door.  Neil glances embarrassedly at his little sister, who's crying fearfully in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man started the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hits Neil) Neil, goddamn it, you're not five years old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, you could have burned the house down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how it started!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew a second ago.  Who started it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!  He gets hit again.  Hard.  He holds his arm and looks about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man started it?  Oh really?  You wanna show me, Neil?  Right, okay, here we go, Neil's gonna show me the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Neil's arm roughly and starts pulling him toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider emerges with a cloud of smoke from under his secret panel in the floor.  He lies here, gasping desperately for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil dragging Neil up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to go see the man. Here we go, Neil's gonna show his dad the man.  Come on, let's go see the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider has practically passed out from his ordeal.  Bu then he hears them coming back up.

dialogues.speaker: ATTIC STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Phil drags Neil up, pushes him forward into the attic.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIDER
dialogues.text: Standing stiff in the shadows behind some old bookcases. He didn't have time to go back under his false wall.  He' here in the attic with them!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: spins Neil around the center of the floor a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see a man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Neil back downstairs and turns with a sigh to look at the charred mess up here.  He goes closer to the burnt carpet and bends over it.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIDER
dialogues.text: Alone with the person he hates most in life.  His fists start to clench.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: gingerly touches bits of the carpet, making sure the fire is completely out.  SUDDENLY, he jumps -- the attic door has swung shut.  He turns toward it -- and a shadow moves somewhere behind him.  He opens the door again -- and there's a little CREAK.  He bends over again, putting something at the bottom of the door to keep it open.  The he thinks he hears something -- turns around again -- but JULIE distracts him, CALLING from downstairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey -- I can't find those large- size Hefty trash bags!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goes downstairs) There might be some extras in the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil is pushed back in, followed by his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was supposed to stay in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him) Get on the other side of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly comes up to watch, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hider has made it back in here.  As the last vestiges of smoke clear, he lies back on his mattress, breathing slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're cleaning up the mess, trying to put trash bags ov the burnt carpet roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, lift up your end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here on the other side of the false wall.  Lying on his mattress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is sitting in a deck chair, looking shell-shocked. Julie is still trying to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, it's not the end of the world.  You'll call Lowenthal tomorrow and find out it was just a mix-up.  And if he's not interested anymore, then you'll find another company to go to maybe even your own.  You are free now, you are independent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fired.  I'm unemployed.  Is that your idea of negotiating from a position of strength?  Clearly any potential employers have been warned to back off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (head down again) Someone blew the whistle.  Someone hates me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider looks at the sky, daylight about to break.  He goes aver the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearing the bottom, he slips and falls the rest of the wa hurting himself as he scrapes his hands and legs.  He pic himself up off the ground, brushing himself off, stumblin slightly again.  Looking around, worried in case his fall was heard, he sneaks away around the corner of the house. ... leaving behind the dog whistle that's fallen out of h pocket, that he accidentally stepped on and kicked to one side.  Dented slightly, but shining temptingly in the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider looks intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are beginning to come to a head.  I can feel it.  And I want everything to be perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've cultivated her interests so that now we have even more in common than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now, don't go creating some artificial environment for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no -- I mean, she's genuinely made me more fulfilled in many ways -- and I hope eventually to be able to teach her a few things, too.  What I mean is, I guess I'm still waiting for just that right -- synthesis between us -- where everything will be understood between us without even the need for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to happen unless you make it happen, my friend. You're going to have to assert yourself a little bit more.  Show your affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe you're right. Everything else is just an excuse. I'm treating the situation with kid gloves because I'm afraid of losing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her how she feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to put yourself out there a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because life isn't about playing it safe.  Life is about taking risks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is packing a suitcase.  Julie has her arms folded an is looking grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you really buckle under a little pressure, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for the best, you know it is. (slams a drawer) Why do my socks keep disappearing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking him) "Honey, I'm a zombie, I don't know whether I'm coming or going."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil comes out of the house, followed by Julie.  He stuff his suitcase in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're even sadder and more burnt- out than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sick to death of hearing your opinion of my state of mind, what you think is for my own good. Without me you'd still be twirling a baton at U.C. Santa Barbara. You're the final straw on this back, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he gets into his car he has a little fit, readjusting the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why the hell is this seat never right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV of someone coming down the stairs slowly, toward the front door that stands half open, the SOUND of Phil's CAR DOOR SLAMMING out there. It's Neil.  Looking unhappy as children do at such moment He glances into the living room where Holly, too young to understand, is watching TV with the Killer Dog.  Neil loo forward again as he hears his DAD'S CAR DRIVING AWAY -- a his mother comes back inside.  She puts an arm around him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie has breakfast with her children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daddy and I are kind of mad at each other right now, so we have to spend some time apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you mad at each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how sometimes Neil bugs you and you just get up and walk away from him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what happens with grownups, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Daddy tease you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he did, and I don't like it any more than you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) He's staying with a friend. (stands) Hurry up now, you'll be late for school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids get in the back of Julie's car.  She helps Holly with her seatbelt, then shuts the door and goes to the front.  As she's about to get in, a CLANKING NOISE makes her jump.  She turns -- seeing the garbage cans of the Nasty Neighbor's house -- and then the Nasty Neighbor himself, standing up from behind one of them.  He looks a her.  She instantly looks away, getting into her oar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we HEAR Julie's CAR DRIVING AWAY outside...  The Hider appears at the top of the stairs.  He strolls down as if he owns the place.  The Killer comes wandering in.  The Hider crouches down to pet him.  The Hider looks around h house, and starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider comes in.  His euphoria is building.  He opens a drawer -- to check that Phil has cleared his stuff out and really gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider opens the medicine cabinet to see that there's no shaving gear.  He notes an empty towel rack -- and see that there's only one toothbrush now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving away from the house -- when suddenly Holly bursts out crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's gone where Rudolf went and isn't coming back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly -- that's not so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly has a plastic container of orange juice with a spil proof lid.  In her hysteria she flings it, the lid coming off, juice splashing all over Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh, Holly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider falls onto the bed, laughing, rolling over, pulling the comforter around him like a shroud.  It's all his now, he's the man.  He sits up with a start when he hears SOMEONE COMING up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie runs up and goes into her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries in and immediately starts to take off her orange-juice-stained dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider is hiding in here.  Peeking out at her.  Watchi her undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie goes into the adjoining bathroom, washing out the orange juice.  She comes out of the bathroom and goes to the closet.  She takes out another dress and starts to pu it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie comes back down to where her kids are waiting.  Hol isn't crying anymore, but looks sulky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, now come on, everything's going to be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil is sitting at an outdoor table, reading a comic book when he hears an OMINOUS SOUND -- a kind of limping SHUFF coming toward him.  He dare not turn around, but he doesn have to, because the Bully, walking with the help at a crutch, appears and sits down next to Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very matter of fact) My friends have been expelled. (pokes Neil) You're gonna be my friend now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bully gets up awkwardly and we HEAR his limping SHUFF moving away.  Neil just sits here and wonders why God despises him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is watering plants.  Moving deeper into the garden, reaching to spray water at out-of-the-way bushes, she com upon a little hidden patch of flowerbed that she certainl never noticed before -- because now it boasts a lovely group of roses that have only recently bloomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The washing machine is going.  Julie is folding clothes that are already done.  Abruptly the washing machine stop with a GRINDING CLANK. Julie looks at it.  She tries pushing its buttons and mak sure that the door is properly closed, but it seems to be broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie looks sad.  She doesn't know what to do with hersel She pets the Killer Dog.  She hears a COMMOTION outside a goes to look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the Nasty Neighbor and his Wife shouting at each other -- and the Nasty Neighbor's Wife getting into a car with another man and driving off.  The Nasty Neighbor jus makes some crude gesture at the departing car and goes ba into his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Killer Dog) Must be something in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, alone, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Rita.  No.  No, I don't want to meet him.  No, Rita.  Yes, I'm fine.  No, I don't want to meet him, either.  Absolutely not, Rita,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie opens the refrigerator, but the light doesn't come on.  She checks the plug.  The refrigerator is broken now too.  She can't stand it.  She slams the door, having a fit, starting to cry,

dialogues.speaker: INT, UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Julie puts away some boxes of Kleenex in a linen closet. The front DOORBELL RINGS.  Julie turns to go downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Julie comes down the stairs to the front door.  The Kille Dog joins her.  She opens the door.  Standing outside is

dialogues.speaker: THE HIDER
dialogues.text: SEE the handyman's clothes he's wearing.  SEE the handyman's business card he's holding out.  SEE the pleasant smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my name is Thomas Sykes, I'm a handyman.  If there's any work you need done, please give me a call,

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: She looks at his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, do you fix refrigerators?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can I make an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) Maybe I could take a look at it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLINK!  The refrigerator light pops on and the whole thin starts HUMMING again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you do washing machines, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just show me the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes him into the --

dialogues.speaker: LAUNDRY ROOM
dialogues.text: The Hider, with his toolbox, starts investigating the broken washer.  Julie watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything breaks at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that always the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're just kind of a roving --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- General handyman, yeah.  I do carpentry, too, painting, almost any odd job around the house.  I do housesitting while the owners are away.  In fact, that's why I've been in the area.  I've been living very close by. (he stands up) Here's the part that's giving you trouble, but I won't be able to get a replacement till the stores open tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider puts the part in his toolbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you when I have the part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly is playing with the Killer Dog.  Julie is reclining in a deck chair, talking to Rita on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course I'm upset, Rita. No, I don't want to go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil climbs out of the swimming pool, notices something glistening in the grass not far away.  He goes toward it. Holly giggles as she twists the Killer Dog's face into various grotesque expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mommy, look at Edgar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil picks up -- the whistle. Holly pulls the Killer Dog's gums apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing dog voice) "Hi. I'm Mr. Edgar!" (turns to Julie) Look, Mommy, it doesn't even hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Well, what do you want me to do, Rita -- I can't just forget fifteen years of marriage.  Well, of course I know you can.  No, Rita, I -- what was that?  -- oh, I thought I heard something on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil starts cleaning the whistle on his towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts it to his mouth.  Holly is spreading the Killer Dog's jaws playfully.  Neil's cheeks start to puff out as he blows.  Holly giggles.  Neil blows the whistle with al his might -- but nothing comes out but PHFFT.  The dent i it has ruined it.  Neil throws the whistle back down on t ground and goes to play with the dog, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider returns home.  He notices the whistle on the ground.  He picks it up and looks at it, alarmed at himse for being so careless.  He puts it back in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is showing the Hider a section of the floor that seems to be damaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll tell you -- the only way of making sure this doesn't spread is to double-coat it with sealant before putting the varnish on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humming to himself, the Hider washes some rags in the sin He rinses them and walks breezily out of the kitchen, bumping smack into --

dialogues.speaker: THE BULLY
dialogues.text: Who's coming in with Neil.  The Bully almost loses his balance but the Hider catches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIDER
dialogues.text: Walking past -- his face suddenly covered with a film of sweat.  Jesus, that kid is the one person who's seen him before.

dialogues.speaker: THE BULLY
dialogues.text: continues into the kitchen with Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, that's some guy fixing the living room floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something nags at the Bully.  He looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is pruning some hedges.  She's startled by the appearance of the Nasty Neighbor, carrying some flowers t present to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing her flowers) I've been cleaning up my yard, too -- I noticed you do some gardening.  Thought you might like these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (The flowers are not very nice.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- well -- thank you, Mr. Stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider works on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie comes in, followed by the Nasty Neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've been meaning to drop by -- just in case you needed anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider looks over his shoulder at the Nasty Neighbor. The Hider seethes with territorial jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie reaches for a tall glass container on a high shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, lemme get that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, thinks the Hider in the b.g., he's acting like a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Because, you know, I couldn't help noticing that we have a lot in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's leaning in the kitchen doorway while she fills the container with water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Yeah, y'know, both of us with recent spousal disappearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (how can she get rid of this guy?) Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider turns away and hunches over the floor as he see Neil and the Bully come back out of the kitchen, walking this way.  A chill runs through the Hider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where are all your toys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's watch some TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are these toys of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of my stuff hasn't been unpacked yet.  Here's the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What toys do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider has to turn away even more.  The Bully keeps looking over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on TV) Hey, look -- the new Pretenders video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bully glances over at the Hider.  Something preying o the Bully's mind.  He tries to get a better look.  The Hider tries to hunch out of the way even more, sweat breaking out again on his forehead. He feels the eyes of the Bully on his back.  Now it's his turn to be scared -- of this kid.  Also, he's anxious to keep track of what his rival from next door is doing with Julie.  It's a horrible situation from any angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie tries to show the Nasty Neighbor to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Nasty Neighbor steps into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, this is a nice den.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking, he backs into the Hider's work area by t doorway, accidentally kicking the Hider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Whoops.  Excuse me, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider might as well be invisible.  He doesn't notice the Hider's look of hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; coming out to entrance hall again) Okay then, you have my number, gimme me a call sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door on him, sighs, and goes off into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bully, with his crutch, is struggling closer to the Hider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna watch TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to see the Hider's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look what's on cable, Bernard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bully turns to see a woman undress on TV.  This interests him.  The Hider, drenched in sweat, seizes the moment and stands up to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider comes out of the living room breathing a sigh o relief.  He keeps his back turned as Neil and the Bully n come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me your room now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go upstairs.  But now the Hider is scared by the fro door suddenly opening!  Phil has come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh -- hi... I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider just gestures Phil in and escapes through the dining room to the kitchen -- passing Julie, who's coming out again.  She's expecting to see the Nasty Neighbor again, doesn't know whether she's relieved to see her husband instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having the floor fixed,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what was that neighbor guy doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I think we should work things out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hider has his back against a wall, breathing hard.  He can hear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie folds her arms as she listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was having a bad day -- I lost that job, I was dependent on other people, I was let down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's always an excuse, isn't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time I came home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a decision for you to make on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Overhearing that brightens the Hider's spirits.  He hugs the Killer Dog.  Everything's going to be okay, afte all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil pretends to be shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Philip, I don't want you coming back here.  And if you want to talk to me -- call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (storms out angrily) This is my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he hears the DOOR SLAM, the Hider leans back against t wall with a happy sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie watches the Hider work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize for that scene with my husband.  You must have overheard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An occupational hazard, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet.  Going into people's homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie tilts her head slightly, studying him.  There's certainly something compelling about this quiet man.  He' leaning forward, muscles rippling in his strong arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no -- I've never really found the time to settle down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must value your independence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've always been able to make my way in the world.  I don't like having to rely on other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice that you can make that choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was alone a lot as a child.  No one to compete with.  My parents ensured that I found happiness in the smallest things.  When you're all alone it's your own world, you don't have to take orders from anybody.  You don't necessarily believe the stories people tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Not me, I fell for it right down the line.  Be a good girl and believe all the fairy tales. (faraway look out the window) He married me because I was pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you were pretty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at him.  Smiles at the compliment.  He loo back at her again and could almost die from the pleasure her smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Therapist looks happy for the Hider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, these are good signs -- she's broken up with him and the two of you seem to be developing quite a rapport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I just feel that the relationship has reached that delicate stage where the slightest little thing could wreck the careful groundwork I've laid up till now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help you if you don't help yourself.  It's really up to you. Brooding endlessly isn't going to help matters any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's so much I want to say to her, it's all jumbled up in my mind, and I don't want her to misunderstand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'll just have to make her understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights off.  Street quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is asleep.  Alone in her bed.  In the dark room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider approaches his special part of the wall.  In th shadows, his face is intense.  This is it.  He knows what he has to do.  He starts climbing the wall.  He's halfway up it -- when a FLASHLIGHT BEAM hits his face!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider climbs back down, shielding his eyes against th flashlight.  The voice laughs, the beam lowering.  It's t Nasty Neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, what do we have here? (chuckles nastily, glancing up wall) You got a pretty good deal goin' here, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider is looking more desperate by the second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I believe I've seen you hanging around here before, haven't I? Correct me if I'm wrong. (suddenly his eyes bulge) OHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Hider's face is wild with madness -- as he jams something against the Nasty Neighbor's stomach -- again a again and again -- stab after stab -- the strength of the Hider's arm lifting the Nasty Neighbor up off his feet -- as the Hider eviscerates him with -- a steel gardening trowel, the sharp point ripping the Nasty Neighbor's guts open, tearing upwards; the Nasty Neighbor's mouth gaping with the shock of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider stands over Julie's bed.  Watching her sleep. His eyes are completely crazy now, completely obsessed. His clothes are splattered with blood.  He's snapped and their time together has come. And yet, for a moment, something still holds him back. She's so beautiful.  Tears come once more to the Hider's eyes.  We SEE that he's building to a kind of crescendo o emotion.  It's now or never.  He begins to breathe quicke he begins to move, to reach for her -- but suddenly the bedroom door is pushed all the way open -- the Hider managing to dart behind it just in time -- as Neil comes rushing into his mother's bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Mom, wake up, Mom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie wakes up.  Neil is holding a baseball bat,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil -- what --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, there's somebody in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Honey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I heard someone downstairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie quickly gets out of bed, reaching for the bedside phone and the emergency pad she keeps there.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODY HIDER BEHIND THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Horrified.  Frozen.  Not daring to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: speaks softly into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello -- can you please help me -- I think there's an intruder in my house.  Yes, we heard someone moving downstairs.  I live on Coral Avenue -- number five eleven.

dialogues.speaker: BLOODY HIDER BEHIND THE DOOR
dialogues.text: OhmyGod, OhmyGod, OhmyGod -- he tries to melt even more into the wall as he hears Julie HANG UP and grab Neil and move out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and Neil go into Holly's room -- and the Hider dart out -- and into Neil's room as he hears JULIE COMING OUT again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Edgar!  Edgar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar, the Killer Dog, moves placidly past the Hider in answer to Julie's call.  The Hider, desperate, is scared by his own reflection in Neil's mirror.  He brings a hand to his face, realizing -- Jesus, if she sees it's me!  He looks around -- and sees Neil's full-head mask of a beard man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly sits up in bed.  Neil shushes her, staying by her side protectively with his baseball bat.  Julie ushers th Killer Dog into the room with them and shuts the door, though not all the way so she can still watch and listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding Killer Dog) You stay with us, Edgar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider has the bearded-man mask stretched grotesquely over his head.  He peeks first, then darts out of Neil's room and straight downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie couldn't see him from here, but she does hear the CREAKS on the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider pauses at the bottom of the stairs, looking bac up, then turns in the darkness toward the front door and -- HOLY SHIT! -- runs smack into Phil!  Phil was the intruder downstairs!  And he's just as shocked to run int the Hider.  Immediately, the Hider clamps a hand over Phil's mouth -- and Phil starts fighting for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and the kids hear the COMMOTION downstairs, sounds that are all the more frightening because they don't know what they are.  For all they know it's one maniac down there destroying the house.  Then they hear a CRY in the night:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But is it the husband or the Hider?  The Killer Dog barks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! -- the two men come tumbling in here -- and in the air above them, gripped by both of them in their struggle -- the shiny gardening trowel.  Phil's eyes are wild with fear as he battles his unknown assailant, the hideous expressionless bearded-man mask looming above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SAVAGE NOISES from downstairs continue.  Holly starts crying, Neil comforting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joins them in a scared huddle) It's okay, baby, the police are coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant SIRENS pierce the quiet of the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider's fingers lose the gardening trowel.  Phil manages to keep hold of it, ramming it against the Hider' rib cage.  The Hider shrieks in pain -- then slams his fi across Phil's head.  The gardening trowel goes skittling across the floor.  The Hider is out of control, on the rampage, insane with fury -- he punches off the mantelpie the second green vase, SMASHING it into a million pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and the kids jump at the scary NOISE from downstair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider advances on Phil, who's groggily trying to get up, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car comes around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider is kicking Phil.  The gardening trowel is on th floor near Phil's hand.  The Hider looks up as the FLASHI RED LIGHT of the police car starts swirling around the ro from the street outside, and he hears the STATIC CRACKLE of the POLICE RADIO. Phil grabs the trowel and slams it into the Hider's leg, With a groan muffled by his mask, the Hider staggers out of the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limping, the Hider stumbles through to the dining room. Phil comes after him, throwing open the front door and punching the appropriate button on the security box that sets off the ALARM BELL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie shoots to her feet at the SOUND of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider runs in, heading for the laundry room and the back door there.  He's the intruder trying to escape now, Suddenly, he's hit on the head from behind.  He falls. It's Phil trying to stop him, clubbing him again with the phone.  The Hider wrestles it away from him, wrapping the super-long flex cord around Phil's neck, strangling him, wrapping it tighter, pull it harder, and Phil is choking and the masked Hider is out of his mind -- and then the SOUND of POLICE RADIOS -- and the Hider has to run again. Phil still trying to hold onto him, but the Hider gets ho of the phone and beats Phil's head with it.  Then the Hid escapes outside, still staggering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO COPS come in, guns drawn, looking around -- hearing t NOISE from the kitchen, running that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting rid of the cord around his neck, Phil stumbles onward in the darkness toward the back door -- as the Cop appear behind him, pointing their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) I'm the owner, I'm the owner! (pointing outside) He's out there -- he's out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop #1 keeps his gun on Phil as his partner goes out.  Ph is shaking with fear and exhaustion.  He manages to extra his wallet from his pocket to show the Cop his ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look -- I live here -- I live here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop #1 and Phil go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop #2 is standing over the pool.  The body of the man in the bearded-man mask floats in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sinks to his knees) I got the son of a bitch. (calls out) JULIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neighborhood people have come out of their homes to see what the trouble is.  There is more than one police car outside the house now -- and an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the body in the pool is being fished in and pulled out, Phil and Julie talk with the police officers.  One o the police officers holds up the gardening trowel.  Phil is being tended to Paramedics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I used that first of all -- then I just kept hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were upstairs the whole time, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- I didn't know what was going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Phil.  He looks back at her with a little pleading look of understanding in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we were upstairs when we heard the intruder.  My wife called the police and I went downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: THE BODY IN THE POOL
dialogues.text: is now laid dripping on the ground.  Someone starts to pe off the mask.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE AND PHIL
dialogues.text: don't really want to look, but have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- we know him.  He's been hanging around the house.

dialogues.speaker: THE BODY
dialogues.text: It's the Nasty Neighbor, his face still looking shocked a it was when the Hider first killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He splashes water on his face.  He rips his sheet to bandage his hurt leg.  He flings clothes around, finding new ones to change into.  He's acting like a crazed, cornered animal -- he's acting like there'll be no need t come back to this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nice Neighbor Woman is comforting the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COP is getting rid of the neighborhood onlookers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, people, there's nothing to see here.  Let's go back to bed now, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil is about to go off with the Paramedics and the Cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get the rest of the details at the hospital, Mr. Dreyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philip, I'll be fine, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (privately to Julie) Should I come home when I'm finished there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) We'll talk in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil goes into the ambulance.  It drives away, The crowd has dispersed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the police leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie turns around.  It's the Hider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) I was driving by -- I saw all the cars.  Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm okay -- it's been a long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing all the mess) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I tell you tomorrow?  I think I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly puts a trembling hand to her head.  The Hide grips her arms reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you don't have to say another word...  You should have some tea, it'll make you feel better.  And I'll clean up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods -- as the Nice Neighbor Woman comes down the stairs with Neil.  Neil still holds his baseball bat.  He clearly being the little man of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holly is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Audrey, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil glances in the living room where the Hider is neatening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Sykes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Neil -- you've had quite a night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, do you want some hot chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks, Mom -- I'll go up to bed now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to come up and tuck you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brave) That's okay, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie realizes how protective Neil is being, gives him a hug and a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were very brave tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, cool, turns to go back upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night, Mr. Sykes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Neil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie shows the Nice Neighbor Woman to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey... (gives her a hug) ... you've been wonderful.  Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves and Julie shuts the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie and the Hider are here.  Julie puts the kettle on. Then she gives the Killer Dog some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking about our conversation the other day -- what you said about choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied) Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know, that in life you really have to choose what you want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing a big discussion) Listen, I'm sorry, but it's really late -- you don't have to come tomorrow to work on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kettle is starting to percolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right -- I really have to go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should talk first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is starting to boil.  The cap of the kettle giv a little BLOW.  The jaws of the Killer Dog savagely munch his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sykes, I think you should go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider gives a little smile, but doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I think you should leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider tenses.  Julie sees that he's had two totally different reactions to what she thought was the same statement in each case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hider moves a step closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Yes, I do understand... (beginning to repeat himself) ... I was thinking about our conversation the other day -- what you said about choices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kettle begins a LOW WHISTLE.  The Killer Dog's ears perk up.  He's been activated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You decided that Philip should stay away.  You made your choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, sensing real danger now, glances at the kettle of boiling water.  The WHISTLE continues to get HIGHER IN PITCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; carried away by his own internal logic) Now things are the way they're supposed to be.  I fixed things in this house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the WHISTLE BUILDS the Killer Dog turns.  Nobody is approaching the kettle at the moment, so the Killer Dog doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she notices -- blood starting to seep through his trouser leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) -- I don't know who you are, I don't know anything about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She measures the distance between her and the WHISTLING KETTLE.  The Killer Dog goes into a crouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to show my feelings.  I have to take action.

dialogues.speaker: THE KETTLE
dialogues.text: The WHISTLE reaches its HIGHEST PITCH.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: rushes toward it.

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER DOG
dialogues.text: springs at Julie!

dialogues.speaker: THE HIDER
dialogues.text: throws himself in front of the Killer Dog.  As the dog starts to tear him apart --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Julie --

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: drops the kettle, starts backing out of the kitchen in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie comes backing out from the kitchen, the kitchen doo swinging closed after her.  She keeps backing away, her hand to her mouth in horror as we HEAR the HORRIFIC MAULING, SNARLING, GROWLING from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AWFUL SOUNDS continue as Julie in a daze keeps backin further and further away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is empty, the neighborhood quiet -- except for the SOUNDS we HEAR of the Hider in the house being torn t bits. And the CAMERA STARTS CRANING UP once more... up to the t of the house, moving in on that small vent up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All his stuff still here.  And his PHONE... which starts to RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGING in here, too, and OVER the savage MAULI SOUNDS the ANSWER MACHINE CLICKS on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie backing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on machine) Hi, we can't come to the phone right now -- please leave your message after the beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's blood splashed on the walls.  The SNARLING is starting to subside, CHEWING SOUNDS continuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on machine) Hi, hon, I'm still at the hospital, but everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN around the Hider's belongings, his shelf, his bulletin board...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I really do think it's time for me to come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... his sign that says:  "ALWAYS REMEMBER TO UNPLUG THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and the kids should have a man around the house.
